conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows (A, B, C, and D) change in position and size when the light source moves to the back left or right.
The direction of the light source determines the direction of the shadows.
The closer the light source is to the object, the larger and more distorted the shadow will appear; the farther the light source, the smaller and sharper the shadow.
The position of each object relative to the light source affects the shadow's orientation and size.
The light source is currently positioned in front of the objects, slightly to the left.
Shadows are cast behind the objects, slightly to the right, as seen in the image.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift to the front right of the objects.
If the light source remains at the same height and distance, the shadows will maintain a similar size but will change orientation.
The shadow of A (Clock) will move to the front right of the clock and may elongate slightly depending on the light's angle.
The shadow of B (Sphere) will move to the front right of the sphere and remain elliptical.
The shadow of C (Rectangular Object) will move to the front right of the rectangular object and maintain its rectangular shape.
The shadow of D (Box) will move to the front right of the box, and its shape will depend on the light's angle but will generally remain rectangular.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the front left of the objects.
If the light source remains at the same height and distance, the size of the shadows will not change significantly.
The shadow of A (Clock) will move to the front left of the clock and may elongate slightly depending on the light's angle.
The shadow of B (Sphere) will move to the front left of the sphere and remain elliptical.
The shadow of C (Rectangular Object) will move to the front left of the rectangular object and maintain its rectangular shape.
The shadow of D (Box) will move to the front left of the box, and its shape will remain rectangular but may distort slightly depending on the light's angle.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the front right of the objects, and their size may elongate slightly depending on the light's angle and distance.
